executive_summary: The Commercial Oven Manufacturing industry is made up of companies that manufacture commercial oven and stoves used to produce retail food or cooked ingredients for sale to food manufacturers. Volatility in the world price of steel has translated into sharp swings in industry revenue over the five years to 2021. Additionally, demand for industry products declined significantly in 2020, as the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic sharply reduced demand for restaurants. Overall, industry revenue is expected to increase at an annualized rate of 0.7% to $4.1 billion, including growth of 15.3% in 2021 as the coronavirus pandemic is expected to abate in the United States, leading to a forecast economic recovery.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Revenue volatility due to COVID-19 pandemic
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The coronavirus pandemic led to a significant decline in industry revenue in 2020 as demand from restaurants, hotels and other end users declined. However, revenue is expected to rebound 15.3% in 2021 as the pandemic abates.
Overall, industry revenue is expected to increase at an annualized rate of 0.7% to $4.1 billion over the five years to 2021, including the expected 15.3% rebound in 2021.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Industry revenue is expected to increase at a faster annualized rate of 2.2% to $4.6 billion over the five years to 2026 as the economy recovers from the pandemic.
Steel prices are expected to rise at a steadier rate after 2021, decreasing revenue volatility and stabilizing operators' cost schedules, benefiting profit margins.

industry_definition: This industry manufactures commercial ovens. Commercial ovens are used to produce cooked food for retail sale or sale to food manufacturers.
key_trends: The global recession fueled by the pandemic led to a decline in steel prices in line with a fall in demand, adding further downward pressure to industry revenue
As the price of steel increases, manufacturers respond by passing on higher costs to downstream buyers, boosting industry revenue
Total wages are expected to rise in line with an increase in the industry labor force
Steel prices are expected to rise at a steadier rate after a sharp increase in 2021, decreasing revenue volatility in this industry
The steadier rate of growth is expected to stabilize operators' cost schedules, benefiting average industry profit
Wages are expected to increase in line with employment
Both industry revenue and average industry profit are heavily influenced by steel prices

market_segmentation.segment_description: Restaurants are the largest customer of Commercial Oven Manufacturing industry products. As every food service location requires ovens, operators rely heavily on the markets overall demand for its products.

Restaurant and hotel equipment wholesalers comprise the second-largest market for operators, making up 22.5% of revenue. These companies distribute, sell and repair commercial machines and equipment used in restaurants, and rely on restaurants for its sales as food service locations represent the majority of its sales.

Exports represent 21.9% of total industry sales for commercial oven manufacturers. Due to its close proximity to industry establishments, Canada is the largest export market, making up 43.1% of total exports in 2021.

products_and_services.product_description: Electric ovens comprise the majority of revenue for Commercial Oven Manufacturing industry operators, and possess several qualities which make them preferred over their gas counterparts.
Gas ovens represent the second-largest product group for the industry, and similar to electric ovens, the items can provide chefs certain advantages over electric alternatives.

Overtime, electric and gas ovens eventually need replacement parts to extend the working life of the industry's products. By cleaning ovens often and maintaining regular maintenance by a certified technician, professional kitchens can delay the need for additional parts and accessories.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Operators rely heavily on the frequency of oven use at restaurants and thus the amount customers that eat at these establishments. The COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic in 2020 caused demand for industry products to collapse, as widespread lockdowns forced operators to temporarily close their manufacturing facilities.

business_locations.location_description: In 2021, IBISWorld estimates that the Great Lakes region of the United States represent 22.5% of industry establishments.
In 2021, IBISWorld estimates that the Southeast region of the United States represents 19.6% of industry establishments.
The West region of the United States accounts for 17.6% of the industry's establishments. California represents the single largest contributor to the industry, with 12.9% of establishments.
Other regions include the Southwest (11.6% of establishments).
Other regions include the Mid-Atlantic (11.2% of establishments).
Other regions include the Plains (7.7% of establishments).
Other regions include New England (5.4% of establishments).
Other regions include the Rocky Mountains (4.4% of establishments).

regulations_points.regulation_description: The industry was forced to temporarily cease operations in 2020 due to COVID-19 lockdowns, but reopened in 2021.
Industry products must comply with standards set by NFPA, ANSI and international bodies related to communication, design and performance.
NSF has developed voluntary consensus standards for commercial cooking and food service equipment.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The industry has high revenue volatility.
The industry has a low assistance level which is increasing.
The industry has a high globalization level which is increasing.

basis_points.basis_description: Companies must offer a wide range of products to meet customer needs.
Spending on R&D is important for new technology products.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Operators retain high customer loyalty due to different operating systems.
Major players can invest in wider product range to expand revenue.
Smaller manufacturers specialize which limits but also advantages them.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Steel is the largest input for industry products. Profit is heavily influenced by steel prices.
The production process remains labor intensive even as automation has increased. Product design requires highly skilled technicians that typically demand higher wages.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Depreciation costs in this industry are relatively low, despite operators investing in heavy machinery.
Labor costs tend to be significantly higher than capital costs as the manufacturing process requires skilled labor.
In 2021, operators are expected to spend $0.08 on capital expenditures for every $1.00 spent on wages.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Revenue is heavily influenced by trends in steel prices, which experienced significant volatility over the past five years.
The COVID-19 pandemic fueled a decline in industry revenue in 2020, but revenue is expected to rebound sharply in 2021.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Operators have implemented smart technology and communication capabilities into products to enable connectivity.
Operators invest in providing customizable oven solutions based on customer requirements and experience goals.
An estimated 73.0% of operators use online ordering systems for procurement of equipment and supplies.
Operators use software, RFID chips and other technologies to improve supply chain and distribution efficiency.

FAQs.question: How is your company impacted by rising imports from abroad?
FAQs.answer: The US dollar has stagnated relative to other major currencies, causing imports to rise as a percentage of domestic demand over the five years to 2021. However, the COVID-19 pandemic led to a decline in imports in 2020, before an expected resurgence in 2021.

FAQs.question: Are your company's sales heavily dependent on the health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: Industry revenue is heavily influenced by demand for restaurants, hotels and other retail food locations, which is heavily dependent on the overall macroeconomic environment. As a results, industry revenue declined significantly in 2020 amid the coronavirus pandemic, before an expected resurgence in 2021.

FAQs.question: Has your company located in proximity to its key downstream distributors to reduce shipping costs?
FAQs.answer: Industry products are very heavy, which makes close proximity to downstream suppliers key to avoiding large transportation and shipping costs.

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to volatile input prices over the past few years?
FAQs.answer: Volatility in the world price of steel has led to heavy volatility in industry revenue over the five years to 2021, as steel is the primary input in the manufacturing process for industry products.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce wage costs by automating operations over the past five years?
FAQs.answer: Companies have increasingly integrated automation into their operations, but the production process still requires skilled workers and technicians.

FAQs.question: How can operators secure a loyal customer base?
FAQs.answer: Operators typically establish relationships with wholesalers and large restaurants, hotels and other end users, in order to establish a reliable customer base to be able to weather economic downturns and other potential shocks.

FAQs.question: How can operators benefit from economies of scale?
FAQs.answer: Larger companies in this industry will often try to acquire smaller competitors in order to benefit from economies of scale and increase their profitability. Some smaller operators were forced out of the industry in 2020 amid the economic shock of the COVID-19 pandemic, while larger companies that were able to take advantage of economies of scale were more resilient.

FAQs.question: Do you track the price of steel? How do you mitigate declines in steel prices?
FAQs.answer: Industry revenue is heavily influenced by the world price of steel, as steel is the primary input for industry products. Volatility in the price of steel has translated into volatility in industry revenue over the five years to 2021.

FAQs.question: Has the decline in the TWI presented an opportunity for your company to expand into international markets amid disruption in domestic markets amid the pandemic? How much of your company's sales are derived from exports?
FAQs.answer: As the trade-weighted index declines, the value of the dollar depreciates relative to other currencies, making exports more affordable to overseas customers while making imports less competitive with domestic products.
